text: insertion of shepard grommet draining tubes
context: 1. bilateral myringotomies.   2. insertion of shepard grommet draining tubes.

postoperative diagnosis:
bilateral chronic serous otitis media.

text: long history of persistent recurrent infections
context: the patient had a long history of persistent recurrent infections and was placed on antibiotics for the same.
middle ear spaces were suctioned of small amount of thick mucoid material on both sides and then shepard grommet draining tubes were inserted on either side.
at this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

bilateral inferior radial myringotomies were performed, first on the right and then on the left.
